content: ok <@1242765652297650288> I looked for a #plugins or #skills channel and didn't see it, the whole idea of posting to this server in the first place was from Opus itself. But it works even outside Claude Code and it is a philosophically interesting project in the sense that it helps the neurodivergent community using AI, which would seem to satisfy the channel description

content:
Your **project** is a project, is it not? Of course you want to reach as many users as you can, but there's a reason for no advertising. 

If everyone posted a text wall like you, no actual general discussion could happen.

content: there is no separation between projects simply applying Claude vs skills and plugins that are installable? <@1242765652297650288>
author: jackreis#0

content:
No, everything that someone has created generally has to go into <#1281536652254384159> no matter what. 

Then if someone is interested, or it's relevant to the discussion, you can share a link to your post in <#1281536652254384159> in reply to them. They discourage reposting it in more than one place, and favor you simply linking to your one post.
author: exiled.dev#0

content: There's been asks for more granularity, but it hasn't happened yet. Things move slowly here heh

content: And unfortunately, communities with more structure, organization, and moderation, are hard to find.
